security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides instructions for resuming Claude Code sessions. No code execution, network calls, or file access capabilities were found. The skill only describes a workflow for managing session files in docs/context-sessions/ directory.

content.value_statement: Lose track of your work when switching Claude Code windows? This skill helps you resume saved sessions and continue unfinished tasks seamlessly.
actual_capabilities: Lists all saved sessions from docs/context-sessions/
Displays session contents with task lists
limitations: Requires context-save skill to create sessions
Only works with markdown session files

use_cases.title: Continue interrupted coding sessions
use_cases.description: Pick up where you left off when switching between Claude Code windows or after interruptions.

use_cases.title: Track multi-task workflows
use_cases.description: Manage multiple concurrent tasks and switch between them without losing context.

use_cases.title: Share session state
use_cases.description: Collaborate on complex tasks by saving and resuming sessions across team members.

prompt_templates.title: List my sessions
prompt_templates.prompt: Use context-resume to list all my saved sessions and show which tasks are pending

prompt_templates.title: Resume specific session
prompt_templates.prompt: Load session 20251128-1430-å®ç°ç”¨æˆ·ç™»å½•åŠŸèƒ½.md and show me what needs to be done

prompt_templates.title: Check remaining tasks
prompt_templates.prompt: After loading a session, show me the remaining tasks and their priorities

prompt_templates.title: Complete and cleanup
prompt_templates.prompt: All tasks are done, update the session and delete the file

best_practices: Update session files immediately after completing each task
Use descriptive session names with dates for easy identification
Delete sessions only after confirming all tasks are complete
anti_patterns: Don't leave sessions open indefinitely without progress updates
Avoid creating too many parallel sessions to prevent confusion
Don't modify session files manually outside the workflow

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Claude Code versions?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill works with any Claude Code installation as it's documentation-based.

faq.question: What are the limits on session storage?
faq.answer: Sessions are stored as markdown files in docs/context-sessions/ with no artificial limits.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with other tools?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on Claude Code workflows but sessions can be shared as regular markdown files.

faq.question: Is my session data safe?
faq.answer: Sessions are stored locally in your project directory and deleted after completion.

faq.question: Why can't I see any sessions?
faq.answer: You need to use context-save skill first to create sessions before they can be resumed.

faq.question: How does this compare to Claude's memory?
faq.answer: This provides persistent task tracking across windows, complementing Claude's conversation memory.
